project.teaser: Considering the growing transport demand and dependence on oil, collective and immediate actions must be taken to abate emissions and mitigate their environmental and health impacts. Very fine particles emissions, and the formation of secondary aerosols through atmospheric...
project.title: AIR QUALITY AND HEALTH IMPACT OF PRIMARY SEMI-VOLATILE AND SECONDARY PARTICLES AND THEIR ABATEMENT
project.keywords: Particle Emissions, Sub-10nm Particles, Secondary Aerosols, Volatile and Semi-volatile Emissions, Internal Combustion Engine, Exhaust Aftertreatment, RDE, PEMs, Emissions Legislation, Air Quality

result.title: Communication basics (website, brochure, poster, etc.)
result.description: This deliverable refers to Task 6.1. By M5, a project visual identity will be created including a brochure, a common layout for presentation-slides and posters, etc. Moreover, a website will be created, and it will be regularly updated with dissemination news and events.

result.title: Measuring VOCs under real driving emission conditions by means of PTR-MS with active countermeasures for the humidity dependence

details.authors: Andreas Mauracher, Klaus Winkler, Rene Gutmann, Philipp Sulzer

result.title: Multidisciplinary literature review report on V/S-V & secondary emissions
result.description: This deliverable refers to Task 1.1. A comprehensive and systematic literature review will be conducted to analyse state-of-the-art knowledge, and gaps, regarding V/S-V primary emissions formation, abatement, and dynamics, as well as secondary emissions precursors, formation, and atmospheric evolution. Available information about health, social, air quality, and climate impacts of emissions will be also reviewed. These are expected to result in a report (first version at M5 and final release at M12).

result.title: Evaluation of primary and secondary emissions from two Euro 6 SUV in laboratory and under real driving conditions

details.authors: Mickaël Leblanc, Armin Wisthaler, Joonas Vanhanen, Andreas Mauracher, Mohammed Salim Alam, Philipp Eichler, Soheil Zeraati-Rezaei, Fotis Katsaros

result.title: In vitro assessment of biological impact of volatile/semi-volatile primary and secondary emissions derived from vehicles

details.authors: Zili Sideratou, Barbara Mavroidi, Fotios Katsaros, Soheil Zeraati-Rezaei

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
